paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Does TRAPPIST-1 b retain an atmosphere, as inferred from JWST MIRI phase-curve thermal spectroscopy and retrieval modeling?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: TRAPPIST-1 b JWST MIRI phase curve
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: One planet; JWST MIRI low-resolution spectroscopy over an orbital phase curve
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Phase-resolved thermal spectra and phase variation measurements used to constrain day-night heat transport and spectral structure near the 15 um CO2 band.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Bare-rock, no-atmosphere null model
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Model comparison against the observed phase-curve spectra
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere-free scenario with minimal heat redistribution, used as the null benchmark for fitting phase amplitude and spectral behavior.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmosphere retrieval family
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Model comparison against the observed phase-curve spectra
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmosphere-bearing retrievals emphasizing CO2 absorption (including the 15 um band) and allowing for non-zero heat transport and moderate pressures.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmosphere retrieval family
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: Model comparison against the observed phase-curve spectra
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Oxidized composition retrievals considered as alternative atmosphere-bearing cases, with weaker constraints on the CO2 signature.

major_limitations: Single-planet study; cannot generalize to all M-dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions (circulation, opacity priors, clouds) affect posteriors.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features.
Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in this dataset.
Degeneracies between composition, clouds/hazes, and circulation remain significant.
